alfredsnippet.snippet:
https://www.inverse.com/article/37184-jeffrey-hall-nobel-prize

Jeffrey Hall, Geneticist Who Won the Nobel Prize, Is Over It
"This will keep me going until Iâ€™m dead."

"On Monday, the Nobel Prize for Medicine and Physiology was awarded to three American scientists for their research on circadian clocks, which has been ongoing since the 1980s. It was an an an unexpected honor for former Brandeis University geneticist Jeffrey Hall who, unlike his co-awardees Michael Rosbash and Michael Young, left the science world over ten years ago -- and not exactly on the best of terms ...

over the years, as his work went unnoticed by funding institutions like the National Science Foundation -- the big discovery for which they were awarded the Nobel happened in 1984 -- Hall ran out of funding and had to leave academia ..."

(cont'd)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Nobel Laureate Lambasts Academic Research - Part 1
